lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* The duke.Deadline class represents a task with a deadline.
* Adds a 'by' field to store the date of the deadline.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param by          the deadline of the task
* returns a String representation of duke.Deadline task.
* @return The String representation of duke.Deadline task
* duke.Duke is a class in-charge of task management.
* It allows users to add, delete, mark, unmark, specify, and list tasks.
* @param filePath The filepath where task data is stored.
* The main function of the duke.Duke application.
* @throws DukeException If an error has occurred in the duke.Duke application.
* The duke.Event class represents a task with a start date and end date.
* Adds a 'from' and 'to' fields to store the state date and end date respectively of the event.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param from        the start date of the task
* @param to          the end date of the task
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* returns a String representation of duke.Event task.
* @return The String representation of duke.Event task
* The duke.Parser class is responsible for interpreting user commands and converting them into actions or tasks.
* Checks if the user input is an exit command.
* @return True if the input is an exit command, false otherwise.
* Checks if the user input is a list command.
* @return True if the input is a list command, false otherwise.
* Checks if the user input is a mark command.
* @return True if the input is a mark command, false otherwise.
* Checks if the user input is an unmark command.
* @return True if the input is an unmark command, false otherwise.
* Checks if the user input is a delete command.
* @return True if the input is a delete command, false otherwise.
* Checks if the user input is a find command.
* @return True if the input is a find command, false otherwise.
* Checks if the user input is a valid task type.
* @return True if the input is a valid task type, false otherwise.
* Parses the user's input and performs the corresponding operations.
* @param tasks     The current duke.TaskList with all the tasks.
* @param ui        The current duke.Ui for user interaction.
* @return True if the program should continue running, false if it should exit.
* @throws DukeException If there's an issue with the user input or task operations.
public static boolean parseCommand(String userInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
throw new InvalidInputException("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, please provide a keyword to search.");
throw new InvalidInputException("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* The duke.Storage class is responsible for loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* @param filepath The file path where the tasks are stored.
* Loads tasks from the file using the file path.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue loading tasks or parsing the file.
throw new DukeException("File Not Found: " + this.filepath);
* Creates a duke.Task from the string representation from the file.
* @param dataInput The string representation of the task.
* @throws DukeException If the string representation does not meet task requirements.
public Task loadData(String dataInput) throws DukeException {
* The duke.Task class represents a basic task with a description and status to determine if task is done.
* Tasks can be marked as done or undone.
* A method that marks the task as undone
* A method that marks the task as done
* An accessor method to retrieve the status of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* An accessor method to retrieve the description of the task.
* returns a String representation of the task.
* @return The String representation of the task
* Tasklist is a class in-charge of task list.
* It has method to add, delete, unmark and mark tasks in the list.
* Constructs a new duke.TaskList with an existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize the duke.TaskList.
* Adds a new task to the task list.
* @throws DukeException If userInput does not meet task requirements.
public String addTask(String userInput) throws DukeException{

public String markTaskAsDone(int taskIndex) throws InvalidRangeException {
return ("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n " + task);

* @return A message confirming the task as undone.
* @throws InvalidRangeException If the task index is exceeds the range.
public String unmarkTaskAsDone(int taskIndex) throws InvalidRangeException {
return ("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n " + task);

* Finds tasks that contains a given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return The string representation of the matching task list.
String taskList = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";
* Returns a string representation of the task list.
* @return The string representation of the task list.
String taskList = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
* The duke.ToDo class represents a task that has to be done.
* @param description the description of the task
* returns a String representation of duke.ToDo task.
* @return The String representation of duke.ToDo task
* duke.UI is a class that handles interactions with the user.
* It is responsible for displaying messages, and reading user input.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Chatty\n" + "What can I do for you?");
* Displays a given message to the user.
* @param msg The message to be displayed.
* @return The user's input as a String.
* Displays an error message indicating that loading a file has failed.
* @param tasks The current duke.TaskList containing tasks to display.
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* The duke.exception.DukeException class represents a custom exception used in the duke.Duke class.
* @param msg The error message of the exception.
* The duke.exception.EmptyDateException class represents a custom exception used in the duke.Duke class.
* It is thrown when the date of a deadline or event task is empty.
* @param msg The type of task for which the date is left empty.
super("☹ OOPS!!! The date of a " + msg + " cannot be empty.");
* The duke.exception.EmptyTaskException class represents a custom exception used in the duke.Duke class.
* It is thrown when the description of a task is empty.
* @param msg The type of task for which the description is left empty.
super("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a " + msg + " cannot be empty.");
* The duke.exception.InvalidInputException class represents a custom exception used in the duke.Duke class.
* It is thrown when the user input is invalid.
* @param msg The error message of the exception.
* The duke.exception.InvalidRangeException class represents a custom exception used in the duke.Duke class.
* It is thrown when the user input for mark, unmark and delete of tasks exceed list length.
* @param msg The error message of the exception.
* The duke.exception.NoEndDateException class represents a custom exception used in the duke.Duke class.
* It is thrown when the end date of the event task is empty.
super("☹ OOPS!!! Please provide a end date for your event.");
* The {@code StorageTest} class contains JUnit tests for the {@link Storage} class.
* It tests the loading of task data from a storage file.
* Tests loading a 'todo' task from a given String representation.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue with task loading.
* Tests loading a 'dealine' task from a given String representation.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue with task loading.
* Tests loading a 'even' task from a given String representation.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue with task loading.
* Tests loading an invalid string representation of a task.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue with task loading.
* The {@code TaskListTest} class contains JUnit tests for the {@link TaskList} class.
* It tests the functionality of managing tasks in the task list.
* Tests adding tasks to the task list.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue with the creation of tasks.
String output1 = "Got it. I've added this task:\n " + "[T][ ] Buy groceries"
+ "\nNow you have 1 tasks in the list.";
String output2 = "Got it. I've added this task:\n " + "[D][ ] Finish project (by: Dec 31 2023 6pm)"
+ "\nNow you have 2 tasks in the list.";
